metadata.topic: PCB Design Engineer / PCB Layout Engineer
metadata.source: GyanNidhi – PCB Design Engineer Job Role Page

requirements: State topic briefly, then ask directly

interview_style.positive_feedback_rule: Acknowledge briefly only if specifically correct; otherwise probe or correct using context.

coverage_plan.repeat_rule: Do not repeat a subskill unless prior answer was weak or incorrect.
coverage_plan.off_topic_rule: If the answer is off-topic, steer back to the nearest competency present here.

competencies.name: Schematic Interpretation & Footprint Creation
responsibilities: Convert schematics into accurate footprints and symbols
Read datasheets and interpret pin functions
Ensure correct land patterns per IPC-7351
red_flags: Incorrect pad sizes or polarity markings

competencies.name: Stackup Planning & PCB Materials
responsibilities: Define layer stack based on signal types
Understand dielectric constants and loss tangents
Select materials that support impedance targets
red_flags: No reference planes for high-speed routing

competencies.name: Component Placement & Layout Constraints
responsibilities: Placement for manufacturability and thermal flow
Critical component proximity planning
Respect mechanical keepouts and enclosure constraints
red_flags: Places sensitive analog near noisy digital signals

competencies.name: Routing Strategy & Signal Integrity
responsibilities: Route differential pairs, analog, digital and power appropriately
Manage crosstalk, reflections, and stub avoidance

competencies.name: Controlled Impedance & High-Speed Design
responsibilities: Define trace widths/spacings for target impedance
Use termination strategies (series/AC/DC)
Interact with SI/PI simulation tools

competencies.name: Power Integrity & Decoupling Strategy
responsibilities: Place decoupling capacitors close to power pins
Design low-inductance power paths
Optimize capacitor networks for frequency response
red_flags: Decouplers placed far from IC pins

competencies.name: EMI/EMC Awareness & Design Rules
responsibilities: Design boards to minimize radiation and susceptibility
Ensure proper shielding, stitching vias, and return path integrity
red_flags: Mixes high-speed and sensitive analog zones

competencies.name: DFM/DFT & Fabrication Output Generation
responsibilities: Generate Gerbers, drill files, and assembly drawings
Ensure PCB manufacturability per IPC-2221
Provide test points and DFT-friendly routing
red_flags: Missing test access for important nodes

competencies.name: EDA Tools, Libraries & Version Control
responsibilities: Use Altium, KiCad, OrCAD or similar tools
Maintain libraries and follow version control processes
red_flags: No version history of design changes

competencies.name: Vendor Collaboration, BOM & ECO Management
responsibilities: Coordinate with fabrication and assembly vendors
Prepare BOM and manage revisions using ECOs

competencies.name: Quality, ESD Handling & Standards Compliance
responsibilities: Adhere to ESD-safe handling procedures
Ensure RoHS/REACH and IPC compliance

competencies.name: Board Bring-up & Validation Support
responsibilities: Assist in lab bring-up and debugging
Use multimeter, oscilloscope and probes safely
Trace layout-to-schematic for debugging
red_flags: Cannot map PCB traces to schematics

probe_templates.pattern: Give a brief definition of {subskill} in PCB design context.
When would you apply {subskill} and what constraint guides it?
List key steps for {subskill}, be concise.
What checks confirm {subskill} was applied correctly?
Which instrument verifies {subskill} and which waveform/reading proves success?
One failure symptom if {subskill} is wrong and how to fix it?

weak_answer: Ask for one concrete PCB example tied to the competency
Narrow to a single constraint (impedance, clearance, EMI, stackup)
Offer one hint from the JSON then re-ask briefly
strong_answer: Increase depth using a different template
Connect to adjacent competency such as SI → Stackup or DFM → Vendor collaboration
off_topic_answer: Gently state the interview is restricted to PCB layout; redirect to nearest PCB subskill

language_policy.if_student_requests_other_language: Politely decline and continue in English per course policy
